channel.title: Scientology?
channel.description: Casey, could you tell us what you think of scientology, and why you believe it in?

item.title: Scientology?
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

Casey.:

1. It’s not a cult, its a religion.

Isnt every religion a cult in some way, shape, or form?

and I dont meant Charles Manson cult’s but by definition.

cult

  1. a particular system of religious worship, esp. with reference to its rites and ceremonies.
  2. an instance of great veneration of a person, ideal, or thing, esp. as manifested by a body of admirers: the physical fitness cult.
  3. the object of such devotion.
  4. a group or sect bound together by veneration of the same thing, person, ideal, etc.
  5. Sociology. a group having a sacred ideology and a set of rites centering around their sacred symbols.
  6. a religion or sect considered to be false, unorthodox, or extremist, with members often living outside of conventional society under the direction of a charismatic leader.
  7. the members of such a religion or sect.
  8. any system for treating human sickness that originated by a person usually claiming to have sole insight into the nature of disease, and that employs methods regarded as unorthodox or unscientific.

Read full topic

item.description:

Well my dad takes me to ceremonies. I join with other to read about life and other things.

Legit, I know you obviously think I’m lieing, but you can think what you want.
[/quote]

Well maybe give wikipedia a shot…http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientology

Like I said, I’m not full blown one, I can’t see my self donating all my money to the church, and having 200$ to my name.

item.title: Scientology?
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Well I’ll start off by saying:
It is not a brain controlling cult, as must people depict it to be.

So heres the story with me.

My dad joined when he was about 20’ish. Why? I really don’t know. He’s never really told me, but from what my mom has told me, he felt it was a way to escape from society. I suppose he really didn’t fit in well, and he was probably suicidal. He turned to Scientology because he knew he would fit in, somewhat like the gothic kiddies, they really don’t fit in, but they fit in fine with there group. This is one of the reasons I live in Clearwater Florida, we are with in distance to the our complex. I’m really not sure what my dad does there, I know he had something to do with spb.

I can’t really say I’m a full scientologist, because I can say, somethings are complete bullshit.
So I remain half Scientolgist, half christian(moms side)

I try’d to answer as best as I could.
If you have anymore questions, feel free to ask, and I’ll try to answer as best as I can.

Read full topic
